en: This highly accomplished miniature by Hilliard shows a woman fashionably dressed in a black dress with extensive detailing painstakingly rendered and an early example of a Tudor capotain hat more common from  1590 onwards.

A few retouched areas are evident around the border. The lighter grey areas in the NIR images at the top and bottom of the miniature, corresponding to the darker regions of the X-ray image, suggest a localised loss of the pictorial layer and the use of blue and green pigments different from the original ones to make good the losses.  
The UV image reveals additional retouching in the black dress of the sitter, which displays a bright green UV fluorescence characteristic of zinc compounds.
Two retouching campaigns are evident based on the use of white pigments: the sitter's dress and the joint line along the top are retouched with zinc white, whereas the blue top and green bottom are retouched using titanium white. 
The heart of the playing card is painted with vermilion.
